result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald R. Hammon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees.  **NOTE:  THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

The defendant will not have any employment where he works directly with children.  No contact with the victim.  No contact with any former students without the probation agent's consent.  
------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  Sex offender treatment (individual or group) at the discretion of the probation agent.  Any other counseling as recommended by the agent.  Not required to register as a sex offender.  
------------------------------

Restitution shall be held open for 60 days, subject to the defendant's right to object and request a restitution hearing in accordance with local court rules.
------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 02/23/2017 - Pursuant to Stipulation and Order for Restitution FILED 02/23/2017, restitution is set at $1,500.00.
------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete thirty (30) hours of community service work, no buyout, each year of probation.

supervisions.notes: **04/10/2017 - AMENDMENT:  Judgment of Conviction is hereby amended to reflect a probation term of one (1) year on Count 2, which is the maximum term of probation allowed by Statutes.

Defendant Donald R. Hammon in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR.  
ADA Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Donald R. Hammon in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  
Case is scheduled for Jury Trial next week Monday, March 21st and is being bumped by another case on the Court's calendar that is being tried.  
FPT and JT are rescheduled.  Parties are advised that we do not yet know which Judge this case will be assigned to after August 1st.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

**11/10/2015 - HEARD OFF THE RECORD:  Parties advise the Court that they have not reached any agreement.  Case is being bumped from the Monday trial calendar by another case going to trial.  Court schedules new FPT and Jury Trial dates.  Final pre-trial on March 16, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.;  Jury Trial on March 21, 22 and 23, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.  (df)

4:06 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant Donald R. Hammon in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court on the Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Due to Selective Prosecution.  Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Continued argument by Attorneys.  Court makes findings and denies Motion.  Case remains on for final pre-trial and jury trial as scheduled.

Defendant Donald R. Hammon in court with attorney Jeff Szczewski for attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

2:48 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances givens.  Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler appeared.  Defendant is not present in Court.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  It is unknown why Mr. Hammon is not here.  Attorney Kuchler tried to contact him by phone but was not able to get in touch with him.  She believes he may have forgotten about today's hearing.  Court authorizes issuance of a Warrant but STAYS it until September 23rd.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Donald R. Hammon in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  ADA Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:33 p.m. State calls Detective Seth Keller who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Powell. State's exhibit #1 marked and identified by witness. 
3:35 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Kuchler
3:42 p.m. - Witness excused. State moves exhibit #1 into evidence. Objection by Attorney Kuchler. Objection overruled and exhibit is received into evidence.  State has no futher witnesses. Defense has no evidence. Evidence closed.
3:43 p.m. - Arugment by Attorney Kuchler
3:43 p.m. - Argument by ADA Powell
3:44 p.m. - Court makes a finding of probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. State files information - reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered by Counsel. Speedy trial waived.
Motion deadline prior to status hearing set for June 29, 2015.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donald R. Hammon in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

MUST POST $5000.00 CASH.
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  17 year old student of the defendant or her residence or Badger High School. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
